_header: All that will a stound dwell / Listen I shal you tell
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283), for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 1598, 3099, 3339, 3355, 3358.
_description: The Seven Gifts of the Holy Ghost — thirty-three couplets

CULIi49.First Lines:
Alle þat well a stownde dwellelysten I xal ȝou
                    telle…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…To receyuyn hem boþe day & nythþer to god
                    grawnt grace and myt
CULIi49.Attributed Title:
Hec sunt dona vii sancti spiritus (f. 188v);
                        Expliciunt Septem dona Spiritus Sancti (f. 190)
CULIi49.Editions:
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “A Middle English Poem on the Seven Gifts of the Holy Spirit.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         70 (1955): 249-52: 250.
